column5: The great thing about fishing is that sometimes you catch a species of fish that you weren't expecting at all, and it just adds to the thrill of it all. I've caught perch on crankbaits that were bigger then they are. I've caught northern pike on salmon lures in lake ontario, and I've caught catfish while out bass fishing.. gotta love the unexpected..

Twice now in my fishing career I have caught very large walleye on 10" believers.  Both times at night ironically one under a full moon for sure and the other one I don't remember what the moon was.  Both times the fish fought so hard I thought for sure I was into muskie.
Pitch,n for buckets and get this stinky ugly looking thing. YUCK
I caught a bluegill on a bass jig before
Cought about a 1 lb. largemouth figure eighting a 10'' jerkbait one time. It followed it in and even swam a full eight before hitting it.
I have only ever caught 3 Walleyes and all of them were caught on 1.5 oz muskie spinerbaits in Firetiger pattern
o i got 2 large mouth last year on the same lure at the same time one on front treble hook and one on the rear
This dang thing wasn't s'posed to hit the Sabiki rig tipped with crawlers!
WOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW   great catch
I think we got a live one here Boys!!!
i was on a flyin and put roast beef on a hook and sinker, caught about 5 pike.

i was using a panther martin for browns and a little bow about 5" got hooked on it and when i was reeling it in a huge 4lb resi came out and smashed the rainbow scales and blood everywhere. i lost the brown in the dirty ass log pile it came from. ive also caught rainbows and large green spinnerbaits off the peir in the summer and about a 20lb carp on a big zara spook. crazy stuff happens all the time ... OH YA i caught a seagull the other day with a matzou.

Not quite as extreme, but I still wish I'd thought to take a pic yesterday. I caught a little Rock Bass on the tail hook of a Rapala body bait longer than he was. Ya gotta like that kind of attitude, like the proverbial flea and the elephant.  On reflection I probably should have just tried jigging with him still on there.  JF

1. I was out fishing with a friend today and we were drop shotting tiny tubes and micro senkos for perch.  All of a sudden my friend hooks into a big (relative to the perch we were catching) pike.  He hooked it perfectly in the side of the mouth.  Hard to catch pike on a drop shot setup when the hook is attached directly to the 8 pound line.  He was using a tiny pearl 2" (yes 2") senko.  The pike was about 9 pounds and we even managed to land it.  I have a pic as well but it is on my friend's phone.   2. The other day I caught a 10" crappie on pearl 10cm x-rap.  (not so unbelievable)  3.  I have a tackle box full of $10-$30 lures and I threw out a popper that I bought at dolarama for a buck.  After only 2 casts I caught a 16.5" 2 pounde smalie.  Too funny.
Gave a buddy a cheap (very cheap) 2" plastic lure from Scotland and he pulled in a 4 pound smallie.
i was using a huge musky lure just for laughs and caught a 1lb small  mouth the back treble hook was in its mouth the lure could have eaten the bass.....

I caught a 9" crappie on a musky spinner bait last week....I dont' know what it was thinking? Also been getting lots of eyes on musky baits this season so far......they'll eat anything it seems.  Sinker
I was jigging for walleye with a white/pink twister tail and a 10 pound pike slammed it.  Amazing I brought it in considering the 6 pound mono without a leader.

One more for you.  About 20 years ago we were downrigging for lakers on simcoe and I was reading fish at about 25 ft over 90ft of water.  Because the LCR 2000 was such a basic finder I assumed the suspended fish were just clutter or false readings.  I threw out a deeper diving big rapala fat rap and caught a 7 pound whitefish.
Heres some of mine   Labour Day Salmon while musky fishing a buchertail    Smallmouth on same buckertail same day    And my ultimate a nice steelhead on a rouser which is a 8" glide bait for musky
I was fishing for pike with a 8" jointed rapala and caught a 3" rock bass

Had a honkin big Perch latch onto a rattlin rap once while fishing for pike, but I guess that wasn't too strange. By far the weirdest is not once but twice nhow I have seen my roomie hook into a big Muskie while we were fishing for Bass. First time was on a 6" Senko. Got it in the corner of the mouth  then ran under a log or something under water. He fought the thing for a good long while, the whole time rubbing his line back and forth across said log. Just when he was about to give up the fish came ouy and after a few mins he landed it. Think it measured out to 41". The Second was while casting tubes for smallies in a river. Again, corner of the mouth, and the fish was landed. Lucky sot...

I've witnessed both Lake Trout and Pike in the thirty lb. range caught with 1 1/2 inch jigs intended for Brook Trout. In fact my good fishing Bud caught a mid 40's Pike last weekend under the same circumstances. It happens too often up here. The fewer Pike that I catch, the better.
Heres one from this year on a musky stalker.
i had a rock bass hit a rapala J13 will fishing for pike.

Perch are a bit nuts.  My friend actually uses Rapala HJ12s for perch.  They love it.  I have also caught small rockbass on big spinnerbaits.  This winter, a student of mine, caught a 50" musky on tiny rapala ice fishing jig.  Corner of mouth caught and landed.
I put a plain hook in the water on the dock and i was about to put a plastic on then a small bass hit it and i got it!
I've done that many times off the dock
I caught nothing on something!
That has happened too often.  lol
20 lb  carp on a Xrap  22" Walleye while floating roe for trout in late february  watched three pike landed on roe in early march
40+ pound carp on a perch coloured floating rapala... hooked in the mouth. very strange! landed on 6lb test mono as well...
9-10# coho on a bead and skin herring rig.  I would estimate the hook traces to be around 6# line tops.
Catfish on a roe bag on the Credit River last fall.  Many suicidal perch attacking my musky spinnerbaits.
caught this one on a bare jig    honest

I was chucking spoons off the pier for salmons in the fall .I watched a 20 lb carp chase down my 2\5 blue little cleo and just smash it. It chased it for a good 6 ft before inhaling it I landed it in shock.

This past winter I caught 2 pike while bottom bouncing worms for trout, which I thought was quite unusual. The really strange part was that I landed both of them even though I had a 4lb fluro leader on.
Had a 4lb OOS smallmouth smash a TopRaider while fishing the French river during the muskie opener.
